predictions.text: University of Michigan 5-year inflation expectations (prelim) for September 2025 will be between 2.8% and 3.1%, reported on 2025-09-13.
predictions.verification_criteria: Verify using the University of Michigan Surveys of Consumers preliminary September 2025 release; the 5-year (long-run) inflation expectations series must be within [2.8%, 3.1%].
evidence: US CPI rose 0.4% in August; sticky inflation keeps Fed cautious (BLS CPI 2025-09-11).
Tariffs filtering into prices add persistence to inflation pressures.
monitoring_signals: Gasoline prices and weekly AAA averages
Consumer sentiment trend and prior UMich readings
Newsflow on tariffs and price pass-through
predictions.rationale: Sticky inflation and tariff pass-through anchor long-run expectations near 3%.

predictions.text: U.S. Import Price Index excluding petroleum m/m for August 2025 will be at or above 0.2% in the BLS release on 2025-09-13.
predictions.verification_criteria: Use BLS Import/Export Price Indexes news release; confirm the Import Price Index excluding petroleum monthly percent change is >= +0.2%.
evidence: Tariffs are slowly finding their way into consumer prices (CNBC, 2025-09-11).
Sticky inflation in August CPI suggests upstream price firmness.
monitoring_signals: Supplier delivery times and input cost PMIs
predictions.rationale: Tariff effects and firm input costs likely lift non-petroleum import prices.

predictions.text: U.S. Retail Sales headline m/m for August 2025 will be between 0.1% and 0.5% in the Census release on 2025-09-17.
predictions.verification_criteria: Check U.S. Census Advance Monthly Retail Trade report for August 2025; the headline m/m percent change must fall within [0.1%, 0.5%].
evidence: August CPI rose 0.4% m/m; nominal spending tends to track price gains.
Real average hourly earnings fell 0.1% in August, tempering real demand.
monitoring_signals: High-frequency card data (BAC, JPM) and Redbook
Gasoline prices’ contribution to nominal sales
Auto sales SAAR and dealer channel checks
predictions.rationale: Price gains support nominal sales, but real income softness caps upside.

predictions.text: U.S. PPI final demand less foods, energy, and trade services m/m for August 2025 will be between 0.2% and 0.5% in the BLS release on 2025-09-12.
predictions.verification_criteria: Verify in BLS PPI news release that the 'final demand less foods, energy, and trade services' monthly change is within [0.2%, 0.5%].
evidence: CPI details show sticky categories (shelter, health care) firming.
Tariff pass-through raises upstream pricing pressure.
monitoring_signals: ISM/S&P Global PMI input price indices
predictions.rationale: Underlying producer price pressures remain firm amid sticky services and tariffs.

predictions.text: At the September 17, 2025 FOMC, the SEP median projection for the federal funds rate at end-2026 will be between 3.0% and 3.5% (midpoint terms).
predictions.verification_criteria: Confirm in the Federal Reserve’s Summary of Economic Projections (September 2025) that the median end-2026 federal funds rate (midpoint) falls within [3.0%, 3.5%].
evidence: Sticky U.S. inflation keeps the Fed cautious on rate cuts.
Policy uncertainty around Fed independence may bias higher-for-longer signaling.
predictions.rationale: Cautious path with disinflation progress implies a 3–3.5% 2026 median.

predictions.text: EUR/USD (Yahoo Finance: EURUSD=X) will close at or below 1.0600 on at least one trading day by 2025-10-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Use Yahoo Finance (EURUSD=X) daily close (UTC). Success if any close on or before 2025-10-31 is <= 1.0600.
evidence: Sticky U.S. inflation and Fed caution support USD strength.
Euro area growth remains fragile relative to the U.S.
monitoring_signals: Euro area PMIs and energy price shocks
predictions.rationale: Rate and growth differentials favor a firmer USD near term.

predictions.text: Nasdaq-100 Index (^NDX) will close at or above 20,000 on at least one trading day by 2025-10-31.
predictions.verification_criteria: Verify via official Nasdaq closing value for the Nasdaq-100 (symbol ^NDX on Yahoo Finance). Success if any close on or before 2025-10-31 is >= 20,000.
evidence: Renewed crypto/tech risk appetite (e.g., Gemini IPO).
AI and consolidation narratives (Paramount/Skydance-WBD bid) support mega-cap tech sentiment.
predictions.rationale: Risk appetite and AI tailwinds leave room for marginal new highs.

predictions.text: COMEX Copper front-month futures (HG) will settle at or above $4.20 per pound on at least one trading day by 2025-10-31.
predictions.verification_criteria: Confirm using CME Group official settlement for the COMEX HG front-month contract; success if any settlement >= $4.20/lb by 2025-10-31.
evidence: Improved risk appetite alongside record gold suggests commodity bid.
Tariff and supply-chain frictions can underpin base metal prices.
monitoring_signals: USD level and U.S. real yields
predictions.rationale: Tight inventories and risk-on tone could lift copper to $4.20+.

predictions.text: For the week ending 2025-09-19, EIA will report a U.S. working natural gas storage change between +70 and +95 Bcf in the Weekly Natural Gas Storage Report released on 2025-09-26.
predictions.verification_criteria: Use EIA Weekly Natural Gas Storage Report; success if the reported net change for week ending 2025-09-19 is within [+70, +95] Bcf.
evidence: Seasonal shoulder-period injections typically persist into late September.
Recent temperatures moderate, easing power burn.
monitoring_signals: Production (Lower 48 dry gas) and pipeline flows
Regional basis spreads and LNG feedgas flows
predictions.rationale: Seasonality and moderate demand favor a mid-curve injection pace.

predictions.text: By 2025-10-31 (UTC), NOAA SWPC will record at least one Kp index reading of 7 or higher.
predictions.verification_criteria: Confirm via NOAA SWPC Kp index records/alerts; success if any Kp value >= 7 occurs on or before 2025-10-31 (UTC).
evidence: Solar activity remains elevated; SWPC expects strong flares this cycle.
Recent prediction: X-class flare likelihood by end-October is elevated.
monitoring_signals: Solar region complexity and CME frequency
predictions.rationale: Solar maximum conditions raise odds of a G3-level geomagnetic event.

predictions.text: UK CPI core (ex food, energy, alcohol & tobacco) year-over-year for August 2025 will be between 2.8% and 3.2%, as reported by ONS on 2025-09-18.
predictions.verification_criteria: Verify in ONS Consumer price inflation, UK: August 2025 release; core CPI (excluding food, energy, alcohol & tobacco) YoY must be within [2.8%, 3.2%].
evidence: UK core inflation has trended lower through summer 2025.
Energy base effects and easing goods inflation continue to weigh on core.
monitoring_signals: ONS prior month core CPI prints
UK services inflation and wage growth (AWE)
predictions.rationale: Core disinflation continues but remains modestly above target.

predictions.text: On 2025-09-18, the Bank of England will cut Bank Rate by 25 basis points.
predictions.verification_criteria: Confirm via Bank of England Monetary Policy Summary (2025-09-18) that the MPC reduces Bank Rate by 0.25 percentage points.
evidence: UK core inflation moderating and growth headwinds argue for gradual easing.
Global central banks signaling cautious normalization as inflation cools.
monitoring_signals: UK wage growth and services CPI
MPC member commentary and vote splits
predictions.rationale: Cooling inflation and softer growth likely prompt a cautious 25 bp cut.

predictions.text: The Drewry World Container Index Shanghai–Rotterdam weekly spot rate published on or before 2025-09-26 will be at least 10% higher than the 2025-08-29 reading.
predictions.verification_criteria: Compare Drewry WCI Shanghai–Rotterdam spot rate on/before 2025-09-26 to the 2025-08-29 value; success if increase >= 10%.
evidence: Logistics costs sensitive to geopolitical and tariff developments.
Recent market chatter indicates tightening capacity and higher bunker costs.
monitoring_signals: Blank sailings and carrier capacity announcements
predictions.rationale: Tightening capacity and risk premia likely lift Trans-Europe spot rates.
